snippet: A relationship with former Gov. Eliot Spitzer seemed to hurt one woman’s job prospects, while the mayor defended a woman on his wife’s staff whose boyfriend had killed someone.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column recalls that Lis Smith, campaign spokeswoman for candidate Bill de Blasio, was denied position in Mayor de Blasio's administration because she was dating former governor Eliot Spitzer; contrasts that with de Blasio's defense of Rachel Noerdlinger, who serves on his wife's staff, after her boyfriend's serious criminal record and hate speech was reported.
lead_paragraph: A relationship with former Gov. Eliot Spitzer seemed to hurt one woman’s job prospects, while the mayor defended a woman on his wife’s staff whose boyfriend had killed someone.

headline.main: The Boyfriend as a Liability in City Hall
headline.print_headline: The Boyfriend as a Liability in City Hall
